Vortex Gateway Known Issues

On some platforms (Windows) using Maven 2.x causes following error message about "absolute path systemPath" for dcpssaj artifact.

     [INFO] Error building POM (may not be this project's POM).

     Project ID: com.prismtech.gateway:opensplice-idl-plugin
     POM Location: Artifact [com.prismtech.gateway:opensplice-idl-plugin:pom:1.0.0]
     Validation Messages:

     [0]  For managed dependency Dependency {groupId=org.opensplice, artifactId=dcpssaj, 
     version=5.7.1, type=jar}: 
     system-scoped dependency must specify an absolute path systemPath.

     Reason: Failed to validate POM for project com.prismtech.gateway:opensplice-idl-plugin 
     at Artifact [com.prismtech.gateway:opensplice-idl-plugin:pom:1.0.0]

The dependency to Vortex OpenSplice's dcpssaj.jar is declared with "system" scope and with an absolute path using OSPL_HOME environment variable.
Unfortunately, Apache Maven 2 has some problems with such configuration, as it seems to check if the systemPath is absolute before to resolve the OSPL_HOME variable. On Linux, we added a '/' before OSPL_HOME as a trick, but this doesn't work on Windows (drive letter is required as first parameter).
Consequently, we strongly advice to use Apache Maven 3, which doesn't experience such problem.

Using Vortex OpenSplice v5.7.1 the Gateway hangs at shutdown (with ctrl+C or kill process).
Only a kill -9 is able to stop it.
This is a known bug in Vortex OpenSplice v5.7.1 (dds3205).
